131// Split a string by a delimiter
132[[nodiscard]] inline std::vector<std::string_view> splitString(std::string_view string, const char &delimiter) {
133 std::vector<std::string_view> result;
134 size_t start = 0;
135 size_t end = string.find(delimiter);
136
137 while (end != std::string_view::npos) {
138 result.push_back(string.substr(start, end - start));
139 start = end + 1;
140 end = string.find(delimiter, start);
141 }
142
143 // Add the last chunk (or the only chunk if there are no delimiters)
144 result.push_back(string.substr(start));
145
146 return result;
147}

501enum class Direction : int8_t {
502 NORTH = 8,
503 WEST = -1,
504 SOUTH = -8,
505 EAST = 1,
506 NORTH_EAST = 9,
507 NORTH_WEST = 7,
508 SOUTH_WEST = -9,
509 SOUTH_EAST = -7
510};
511
512[[nodiscard]] constexpr Direction make_direction(Direction dir, Color c) noexcept {
513 if (c == Color::BLACK) return static_cast<Direction>(-static_cast<int8_t>(dir));
514 return dir;
515}
516
517constexpr Square operator+(Square sq, Direction dir) {
518 return static_cast<Square>(sq.index() + static_cast<int8_t>(dir));
519}

525class Bitboard {
526 public:
527 constexpr Bitboard() : bits(0) {}
528 constexpr Bitboard(std::uint64_t bits) : bits(bits) {}
529 constexpr Bitboard(File file) : bits(0) {
530 assert(file != File::NO_FILE);
531 bits = 0x0101010101010101ULL << static_cast<int>(file.internal());
532 }
533 constexpr Bitboard(Rank rank) : bits(0) {
534 assert(rank != Rank::NO_RANK);
535 bits = 0xFFULL << (8 * static_cast<int>(rank.internal()));
536 }
537
538 explicit operator bool() const noexcept { return bits != 0; }
539
540 explicit operator std::string() const {
541 std::bitset<64> b(bits);
542 std::string str_bitset = b.to_string();
543
544 std::string str;
545
546 for (int i = 0; i < 64; i += 8) {
547 std::string x = str_bitset.substr(i, 8);
548 std::reverse(x.begin(), x.end());
549 str += x + '\n';
550 }
551 return str;
552 }
553
554 constexpr Bitboard operator&&(bool rhs) const noexcept { return Bitboard(bits && rhs); }
555
556 constexpr Bitboard operator&(std::uint64_t rhs) const noexcept { return Bitboard(bits & rhs); }
557 constexpr Bitboard operator|(std::uint64_t rhs) const noexcept { return Bitboard(bits | rhs); }
558 constexpr Bitboard operator^(std::uint64_t rhs) const noexcept { return Bitboard(bits ^ rhs); }
559 constexpr Bitboard operator<<(std::uint64_t rhs) const noexcept { return Bitboard(bits << rhs); }
560 constexpr Bitboard operator>>(std::uint64_t rhs) const noexcept { return Bitboard(bits >> rhs); }
561 constexpr bool operator==(std::uint64_t rhs) const noexcept { return bits == rhs; }
562 constexpr bool operator!=(std::uint64_t rhs) const noexcept { return bits != rhs; }
563
564 constexpr Bitboard operator&(const Bitboard& rhs) const noexcept { return Bitboard(bits & rhs.bits); }
565 constexpr Bitboard operator|(const Bitboard& rhs) const noexcept { return Bitboard(bits | rhs.bits); }
566 constexpr Bitboard operator^(const Bitboard& rhs) const noexcept { return Bitboard(bits ^ rhs.bits); }
567 constexpr Bitboard operator~() const noexcept { return Bitboard(~bits); }
568
569 constexpr Bitboard& operator&=(const Bitboard& rhs) noexcept {
570 bits &= rhs.bits;
571 return *this;
572 }
573
574 constexpr Bitboard& operator|=(const Bitboard& rhs) noexcept {
575 bits |= rhs.bits;
576 return *this;
577 }
578
579 constexpr Bitboard& operator^=(const Bitboard& rhs) noexcept {
580 bits ^= rhs.bits;
581 return *this;
582 }
583
584 constexpr bool operator==(const Bitboard& rhs) const noexcept { return bits == rhs.bits; }
585 constexpr bool operator!=(const Bitboard& rhs) const noexcept { return bits != rhs.bits; }
586 constexpr bool operator||(const Bitboard& rhs) const noexcept { return bits || rhs.bits; }
587 constexpr bool operator&&(const Bitboard& rhs) const noexcept { return bits && rhs.bits; }
588
589 constexpr Bitboard& set(int index) noexcept {
590 assert(index >= 0 && index < 64);
591 bits |= (1ULL << index);
592 return *this;
593 }
594
595 [[nodiscard]] constexpr bool check(int index) const noexcept {
596 assert(index >= 0 && index < 64);
597 return bits & (1ULL << index);
598 }
599
600 constexpr Bitboard& clear(int index) noexcept {
601 assert(index >= 0 && index < 64);
602 bits &= ~(1ULL << index);
603 return *this;
604 }
605
606 constexpr Bitboard& clear() noexcept {
607 bits = 0;
608 return *this;
609 }
610
611 [[nodiscard]] static constexpr Bitboard fromSquare(int index) noexcept {
612 assert(index >= 0 && index < 64);
613 return Bitboard(1ULL << index);
614 }
615
616 [[nodiscard]] static constexpr Bitboard fromSquare(Square sq) noexcept {
617 assert(sq.index() >= 0 && sq.index() < 64);
618 return Bitboard(1ULL << sq.index());
619 }
620
621 [[nodiscard]] constexpr bool empty() const noexcept { return bits == 0; }
622
623 [[nodiscard]]
624#if !defined(_MSC_VER)
625 constexpr
626#endif
627 int lsb() const noexcept {
628 assert(bits != 0);
629#if __cplusplus >= 202002L
630 return std::countr_zero(bits);
631#else
632# if defined(__GNUC__)
633 return __builtin_ctzll(bits);
634# elif defined(_MSC_VER)
635 unsigned long idx;
636 _BitScanForward64(&idx, bits);
637 return static_cast<int>(idx);
638# else
639# error "Compiler not supported."
640# endif
641#endif
642 }
643
644 [[nodiscard]]
645#if !defined(_MSC_VER)
646 constexpr
647#endif
648 int msb() const noexcept {
649 assert(bits != 0);
650
651#if __cplusplus >= 202002L
652 return std::countl_zero(bits) ^ 63;
653#else
654# if defined(__GNUC__)
655 return 63 ^ __builtin_clzll(bits);
656# elif defined(_MSC_VER)
657 unsigned long idx;
658 _BitScanReverse64(&idx, bits);
659 return static_cast<int>(idx);
660# else
661# error "Compiler not supported."
662# endif
663#endif
664 }
665
666 [[nodiscard]]
667#if !defined(_MSC_VER)
668 constexpr
669#endif
670 int count() const noexcept {
671#if __cplusplus >= 202002L
672 return std::popcount(bits);
673#else
674# if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
675 return static_cast<int>(_mm_popcnt_u64(bits));
676# else
677 return __builtin_popcountll(bits);
678# endif
679#endif
680 }
681
682 [[nodiscard]]
683#if !defined(_MSC_VER)
684 constexpr
685#endif
686 std::uint8_t pop() noexcept {
687 assert(bits != 0);
688 std::uint8_t index = lsb();
689 bits &= bits - 1;
690 return index;
691 }
692
693 [[nodiscard]] constexpr std::uint64_t getBits() const noexcept { return bits; }
694
695 friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const Bitboard& bb);
696
697 private:
698 std::uint64_t bits;
699};

715class attacks {
716 using U64 = std::uint64_t;
717 struct Magic {
718 U64 mask;
719 U64 magic;
720 Bitboard *attacks;
721 U64 shift;
722
723 U64 operator()(Bitboard b) const { return (((b & mask)).getBits() * magic) >> shift; }
724 };

736 // clang-format off
737 // pre-calculated lookup table for pawn attacks
738 static constexpr Bitboard PawnAttacks[2][64] = {
739 // white pawn attacks
740 { 0x200, 0x500, 0xa00, 0x1400,
741 0x2800, 0x5000, 0xa000, 0x4000,
742 0x20000, 0x50000, 0xa0000, 0x140000,

970class PieceType {
971 public:
972 enum class underlying : std::uint8_t {
973 PAWN,
974 KNIGHT,
975 BISHOP,
976 ROOK,
977 QUEEN,
978 KING,
979 NONE,
980 };
981
982 constexpr PieceType() : pt(underlying::NONE) {}
983 constexpr PieceType(underlying pt) : pt(pt) {}
984 constexpr explicit PieceType(std::string_view type) : pt(underlying::NONE) {
985 assert(type.size() > 0);
986 switch (type.data()[0]) {
987 case 'P':
988 pt = underlying::PAWN;
989 break;
990 case 'N':
991 pt = underlying::KNIGHT;
992 break;
993 case 'B':
994 pt = underlying::BISHOP;
995 break;
996 case 'R':
997 pt = underlying::ROOK;
998 break;
999 case 'Q':
1000 pt = underlying::QUEEN;
1001 break;
1002 case 'K':
1003 pt = underlying::KING;
1004 break;
1005
1006 case 'p':
1007 pt = underlying::PAWN;
1008 break;
1009 case 'n':
1010 pt = underlying::KNIGHT;
1011 break;
1012 case 'b':
1013 pt = underlying::BISHOP;
1014 break;
1015 case 'r':
1016 pt = underlying::ROOK;
1017 break;
1018 case 'q':
1019 pt = underlying::QUEEN;
1020 break;
1021 case 'k':
1022 pt = underlying::KING;
1023 break;
1024 default:
1025 pt = underlying::NONE;
1026 break;
1027 }
1028 }
1029
1030 explicit operator std::string() const {
1031 switch (pt) {
1032 case underlying::PAWN:
1033 return "p";
1034 case underlying::KNIGHT:
1035 return "n";
1036 case underlying::BISHOP:
1037 return "b";
1038 case underlying::ROOK:
1039 return "r";
1040 case underlying::QUEEN:
1041 return "q";
1042 case underlying::KING:
1043 return "k";
1044 default:
1045 return " ";
1046 }
1047 }
1048
1049 constexpr bool operator==(const PieceType& rhs) const noexcept { return pt == rhs.pt; }
1050 constexpr bool operator!=(const PieceType& rhs) const noexcept { return pt != rhs.pt; }
1051
1052 constexpr operator int() const noexcept { return static_cast<int>(pt); }
1053
1054 [[nodiscard]] constexpr underlying internal() const noexcept { return pt; }
1055
1056 static constexpr underlying PAWN = underlying::PAWN;
1057 static constexpr underlying KNIGHT = underlying::KNIGHT;
1058 static constexpr underlying BISHOP = underlying::BISHOP;
1059 static constexpr underlying ROOK = underlying::ROOK;
1060 static constexpr underlying QUEEN = underlying::QUEEN;
1061 static constexpr underlying KING = underlying::KING;
1062 static constexpr underlying NONE = underlying::NONE;
1063
1064 private:
1065 underlying pt;
1066};
1067
1068inline std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const PieceType& pt) {
1069 os << static_cast<std::string>(pt);
1070 return os;
1071}
1072
1073class Piece {
1074 public:
1075 enum class underlying : std::uint8_t {
1076 WHITEPAWN,
1077 WHITEKNIGHT,
1078 WHITEBISHOP,
1079 WHITEROOK,
1080 WHITEQUEEN,
1081 WHITEKING,
1082 BLACKPAWN,
1083 BLACKKNIGHT,
1084 BLACKBISHOP,
1085 BLACKROOK,
1086 BLACKQUEEN,
1087 BLACKKING,
1088 NONE
1089 };
1090
1091 constexpr Piece() : piece(underlying::NONE) {}
1092 constexpr Piece(underlying piece) : piece(piece) {}
1093 constexpr Piece(PieceType type, Color color)
1094 : piece(color == Color::NONE ? Piece::NONE
1095 : type == PieceType::NONE ? Piece::NONE
1096 : static_cast<underlying>(static_cast<int>(color.internal()) * 6 + type)) {}
1097 constexpr Piece(Color color, PieceType type)
1098 : piece(color == Color::NONE ? Piece::NONE
1099 : type == PieceType::NONE ? Piece::NONE
1100 : static_cast<underlying>(static_cast<int>(color.internal()) * 6 + type)) {}
1101 constexpr Piece(std::string_view p) : piece(underlying::NONE) { piece = convertCharToUnderlying(p[0]); }
1102
1103 constexpr bool operator<(const Piece& rhs) const noexcept { return piece < rhs.piece; }
1104 constexpr bool operator>(const Piece& rhs) const noexcept { return piece > rhs.piece; }
1105 constexpr bool operator==(const Piece& rhs) const noexcept { return piece == rhs.piece; }
1106 constexpr bool operator!=(const Piece& rhs) const noexcept { return piece != rhs.piece; }
1107
1108 constexpr bool operator==(const underlying& rhs) const noexcept { return piece == rhs; }
1109 constexpr bool operator!=(const underlying& rhs) const noexcept { return piece != rhs; }
1110
1111 constexpr bool operator==(const PieceType& rhs) const noexcept { return type() == rhs; }
1112 constexpr bool operator!=(const PieceType& rhs) const noexcept { return type() != rhs; }
1113
1114 explicit operator std::string() const {
1115 switch (piece) {
1116 case WHITEPAWN:
1117 return "P";
1118 case WHITEKNIGHT:
1119 return "N";
1120 case WHITEBISHOP:
1121 return "B";
1122 case WHITEROOK:
1123 return "R";
1124 case WHITEQUEEN:
1125 return "Q";
1126 case WHITEKING:
1127 return "K";
1128 // black
1129 case BLACKPAWN:
1130 return "p";
1131 case BLACKKNIGHT:
1132 return "n";
1133 case BLACKBISHOP:
1134 return "b";
1135 case BLACKROOK:
1136 return "r";
1137 case BLACKQUEEN:
1138 return "q";
1139 case BLACKKING:
1140 return "k";
1141 default:
1142 return ".";
1143 }
1144 }
1145
1146 constexpr operator int() const noexcept { return static_cast<int>(piece); }
1147
1148 [[nodiscard]] constexpr PieceType type() const noexcept {
1149 if (piece == NONE) return PieceType::NONE;
1150 // return static_cast<PieceType::underlying>(int(piece) % 6);
1151 return static_cast<PieceType::underlying>(static_cast<int>(piece) > 5 ? static_cast<int>(piece) - 6
1152 : static_cast<int>(piece));
1153 }
1154
1155 [[nodiscard]] constexpr Color color() const noexcept {
1156 if (piece == NONE) return Color::NONE;
1157 return static_cast<Color>(static_cast<int>(piece) / 6);
1158 }
1159
1160 [[nodiscard]] constexpr underlying internal() const noexcept { return piece; }
1161
1162 static constexpr underlying NONE = underlying::NONE;
1163 static constexpr underlying WHITEPAWN = underlying::WHITEPAWN;
1164 static constexpr underlying WHITEKNIGHT = underlying::WHITEKNIGHT;
1165 static constexpr underlying WHITEBISHOP = underlying::WHITEBISHOP;
1166 static constexpr underlying WHITEROOK = underlying::WHITEROOK;
1167 static constexpr underlying WHITEQUEEN = underlying::WHITEQUEEN;
1168 static constexpr underlying WHITEKING = underlying::WHITEKING;
1169 static constexpr underlying BLACKPAWN = underlying::BLACKPAWN;
1170 static constexpr underlying BLACKKNIGHT = underlying::BLACKKNIGHT;
1171 static constexpr underlying BLACKBISHOP = underlying::BLACKBISHOP;
1172 static constexpr underlying BLACKROOK = underlying::BLACKROOK;
1173 static constexpr underlying BLACKQUEEN = underlying::BLACKQUEEN;
1174 static constexpr underlying BLACKKING = underlying::BLACKKING;
1175
1176 private:
1177 underlying piece;
1178
1179 [[nodiscard]] constexpr static underlying convertCharToUnderlying(char c) {
1180 switch (c) {
1181 case 'P':
1182 return WHITEPAWN;
1183 case 'N':
1184 return WHITEKNIGHT;
1185 case 'B':
1186 return WHITEBISHOP;
1187 case 'R':
1188 return WHITEROOK;
1189 case 'Q':
1190 return WHITEQUEEN;
1191 case 'K':
1192 return WHITEKING;
1193 case 'p':
1194 return BLACKPAWN;
1195 case 'n':
1196 return BLACKKNIGHT;
1197 case 'b':
1198 return BLACKBISHOP;
1199 case 'r':
1200 return BLACKROOK;
1201 case 'q':
1202 return BLACKQUEEN;
1203 case 'k':
1204 return BLACKKING;
1205 default:
1206 return NONE;
1207 }
1208 }
1209};
1210} // namespace chess
1211
1212namespace chess {
1213
1214class Move {
1215 public:
1216 Move() = default;
1217 constexpr Move(std::uint16_t move) : move_(move), score_(0) {}
1218
1227 template <std::uint16_t MoveType = 0>
1228 [[nodiscard]] static constexpr Move make(Square source, Square target, PieceType pt = PieceType::KNIGHT) noexcept {
1229 assert(pt >= PieceType(PieceType::KNIGHT) && pt <= PieceType(PieceType::QUEEN));
1230
1231 std::uint16_t bits_promotion = static_cast<std::uint16_t>(pt - PieceType(PieceType::KNIGHT));
1232
1233 return Move(MoveType + (bits_promotion << 12) + (source.index() << 6) + target.index());
1234 }
1235
1240 [[nodiscard]] constexpr Square from() const noexcept { return static_cast<Square>((move_ >> 6) & 0x3F); }
1241
1246 [[nodiscard]] constexpr Square to() const noexcept { return static_cast<Square>(move_ & 0x3F); }
1247
1252 [[nodiscard]] constexpr std::uint16_t typeOf() const noexcept {
1253 return static_cast<std::uint16_t>(move_ & (3 << 14));
1254 }
1255
1260 [[nodiscard]] constexpr PieceType promotionType() const noexcept {
1261 return static_cast<PieceType::underlying>(((move_ >> 12) & 3) + PieceType(PieceType::KNIGHT));
1262 }
1263
1268 constexpr void setScore(std::int16_t score) noexcept { score_ = score; }
1269
1270 [[nodiscard]] constexpr std::uint16_t move() const noexcept { return move_; }
1271 [[nodiscard]] constexpr std::int16_t score() const noexcept { return score_; }
1272
1273 constexpr bool operator==(const Move &rhs) const noexcept { return move_ == rhs.move_; }
1274 constexpr bool operator!=(const Move &rhs) const noexcept { return move_ != rhs.move_; }
1275
1276 static constexpr std::uint16_t NO_MOVE = 0;
1277 static constexpr std::uint16_t NULL_MOVE = 65;
1278 static constexpr std::uint16_t NORMAL = 0;
1279 static constexpr std::uint16_t PROMOTION = 1 << 14;
1280 static constexpr std::uint16_t ENPASSANT = 2 << 14;
1281 static constexpr std::uint16_t CASTLING = 3 << 14;
1282
1283 private:
1284 std::uint16_t move_;
1285 std::int16_t score_;
1286};
1287
1288inline std::ostream &operator<<(std::ostream &os, const Move &move) {
1289 Square from_sq = move.from();
1290 Square to_sq = move.to();
1291
1292 os << from_sq << to_sq;
1293
1294 if (move.typeOf() == Move::PROMOTION) {
1295 os << static_cast<std::string>(move.promotionType());
1296 }
1297
1298 return os;
1299}
1300} // namespace chess

1306#include <stdexcept>

1309namespace chess {
1310class Movelist {
1311 public:
1312 using value_type = Move;
1313 using size_type = int;
1314 using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
1315 using reference = value_type&;
1316 using const_reference = const value_type&;
1317 using pointer = value_type*;
1318 using const_pointer = const value_type*;
1319
1320 using iterator = value_type*;
1321 using const_iterator = const value_type*;
1322
1323 using reverse_iterator = std::reverse_iterator<iterator>;
1324 using const_reverse_iterator = std::reverse_iterator<const_iterator>;
1325
1326 // Element access
1327
1328 [[nodiscard]] constexpr reference at(size_type pos) {
1329#ifndef CHESS_NO_EXCEPTIONS
1330 if (pos >= size_) {
1331 throw std::out_of_range("Movelist::at: pos (which is " + std::to_string(pos) + ") >= size (which is " +
1332 std::to_string(size_) + ")");
1333 }
1334#endif
1335 return moves_[pos];
1336 }
1337
1338 [[nodiscard]] constexpr const_reference at(size_type pos) const {
1339#ifndef CHESS_NO_EXCEPTIONS
1340 if (pos >= size_) {
1341 throw std::out_of_range("Movelist::at: pos (which is " + std::to_string(pos) + ") >= size (which is " +
1342 std::to_string(size_) + ")");
1343 }
1344#endif
1345 return moves_[pos];
1346 }
1347
1348 [[nodiscard]] constexpr reference operator[](size_type pos) noexcept { return moves_[pos]; }
1349 [[nodiscard]] constexpr const_reference operator[](size_type pos) const noexcept { return moves_[pos]; }
1350
1351 [[nodiscard]] constexpr reference front() noexcept { return moves_[0]; }
1352 [[nodiscard]] constexpr const_reference front() const noexcept { return moves_[0]; }
1353
1354 [[nodiscard]] constexpr reference back() noexcept { return moves_[size_ - 1]; }
1355 [[nodiscard]] constexpr const_reference back() const noexcept { return moves_[size_ - 1]; }
1356
1357 // Iterators
1358
1359 [[nodiscard]] constexpr iterator begin() noexcept { return &moves_[0]; }
1360 [[nodiscard]] constexpr const_iterator begin() const noexcept { return &moves_[0]; }
1361
1362 [[nodiscard]] constexpr iterator end() noexcept { return &moves_[0] + size_; }
1363 [[nodiscard]] constexpr const_iterator end() const noexcept { return &moves_[0] + size_; }
1364
1365 // Capacity
1366
1371 [[nodiscard]] constexpr bool empty() const noexcept { return size_ == 0; }
1372
1377 [[nodiscard]] constexpr size_type size() const noexcept { return size_; }
1378
1379 // Modifiers
1380
1384 constexpr void clear() noexcept { size_ = 0; }
1385
1390 constexpr void add(const_reference move) noexcept {
1391 assert(size_ < constants::MAX_MOVES);
1392 moves_[size_++] = move;
1393 }
1394
1399 constexpr void add(value_type&& move) noexcept {
1400 assert(size_ < constants::MAX_MOVES);
1401 moves_[size_++] = move;
1402 }
1403
1404 // Other
1405
1411 [[nodiscard]] [[deprecated("Use std::find() instead.")]] constexpr size_type find(value_type move) const noexcept {
1412 for (size_type i = 0; i < size_; ++i) {
1413 if (moves_[i] == move) {
1414 return i;
1415 }
1416 }
1417
1418 return -1;
1419 }
1420
1421 private:
1422 std::array<value_type, constants::MAX_MOVES> moves_;
1423 size_type size_ = 0;
1424};
1425} // namespace chess
1426

1432 ROOK = 8,
1433 QUEEN = 16,
1434 KING = 32,
1435};

1675 static constexpr std::array<U64, 16> castlingKey = []() constexpr {
1676 auto generateCastlingKey = [](int index) constexpr -> U64 {
1677 constexpr int RANDOM_OFFSET = 768;
1678 constexpr int RANDOM_COUNT = 4;
1679
1680 U64 key = 0;
1681
1682 for (int i = 0; i < RANDOM_COUNT; ++i) {
1683 if (index & (1 << i)) {
1684 key ^= RANDOM_ARRAY[RANDOM_OFFSET + i];
1685 }
1686 }
1687
1688 return key;
1689 };
1690
1691 std::array<U64, 16> arr{};
1692
1693 for (int i = 0; i < 16; ++i) arr[i] = generateCastlingKey(i);
1694
1695 return arr;
1696 }();
1697
1698 static constexpr int MAP_HASH_PIECE[12] = {1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 11, 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10};
1699
1700 [[nodiscard]] static U64 piece(Piece piece, Square square) noexcept {
1701 assert(piece < 12);
1702#if __cplusplus >= 202207L
1703 [[assume(x < 12)]];
1704#endif
1705 return RANDOM_ARRAY[64 * MAP_HASH_PIECE[piece] + square.index()];
1706 }
1707
1708 [[nodiscard]] static U64 enpassant(File file) noexcept {
1709 assert(int(file) < 8);
1710#if __cplusplus >= 202207L
1711 [[assume(x < 8)]];
1712#endif
1713 return RANDOM_ARRAY[772 + file];
1714 }
1715
1716 [[nodiscard]] static U64 castling(int castling) noexcept {
1717 assert(castling >= 0 && castling < 16);
1718#if __cplusplus >= 202207L
1719 [[assume(x < 16)]];
1720#endif
1721 return castlingKey[castling];
1722 }
1723
1724 [[nodiscard]] static U64 castlingIndex(int idx) noexcept {
1725 assert(idx >= 0 && idx < 4);
1726#if __cplusplus >= 202207L
1727 [[assume(x < 4)]];
1728#endif
1729 return RANDOM_ARRAY[768 + idx];
1730 }
1731
1732 [[nodiscard]] static U64 sideToMove() noexcept { return RANDOM_ARRAY[780]; }
1733
1734 public:
1735 friend class Board;
1736};

1753// A compact representation of the board in 24 bytes,
1754// does not include the half-move clock or full move number.
1755using PackedBoard = std::array<std::uint8_t, 24>;
1756
1757class Board {
1758 using U64 = std::uint64_t;
1759
1760 public:
1761 class CastlingRights {
1762 public:
1763 enum class Side : uint8_t { KING_SIDE, QUEEN_SIDE };
1764
1765 constexpr void setCastlingRight(Color color, Side castle, File rook_file) {
1766 rooks[color][static_cast<int>(castle)] = rook_file;
1767 }
1768
1769 constexpr void clear() { rooks[0][0] = rooks[0][1] = rooks[1][0] = rooks[1][1] = File::NO_FILE; }
1770
1771 constexpr int clear(Color color, Side castle) {
1772 rooks[color][static_cast<int>(castle)] = File::NO_FILE;
1773 return color * 2 + static_cast<int>(castle);
1774 }
1775
1776 constexpr void clear(Color color) { rooks[color][0] = rooks[color][1] = File::NO_FILE; }
1777
1778 constexpr bool has(Color color, Side castle) const {
1779 return rooks[color][static_cast<int>(castle)] != File::NO_FILE;
1780 }
1781
1782 constexpr bool has(Color color) const { return has(color, Side::KING_SIDE) || has(color, Side::QUEEN_SIDE); }
1783
1784 constexpr File getRookFile(Color color, Side castle) const { return rooks[color][static_cast<int>(castle)]; }
1785
1786 constexpr int hashIndex() const {
1787 return has(Color::WHITE, Side::KING_SIDE) + 2 * has(Color::WHITE, Side::QUEEN_SIDE) +
1788 4 * has(Color::BLACK, Side::KING_SIDE) + 8 * has(Color::BLACK, Side::QUEEN_SIDE);
1789 }
1790
1791 constexpr bool isEmpty() const { return !has(Color::WHITE) && !has(Color::BLACK); }
1792
1793 template <typename T>
1794 static constexpr Side closestSide(T sq, T pred) {
1795 return sq > pred ? Side::KING_SIDE : Side::QUEEN_SIDE;
1796 }
1797
1798 private:
1799 std::array<std::array<File, 2>, 2> rooks;
1800 };
1801
1802 private:
1803 struct State {
1804 U64 hash;
1805 CastlingRights castling;
1806 Square enpassant;
1807 uint8_t half_moves;
1808 Piece captured_piece;
1809
1810 State(const U64 &hash, const CastlingRights &castling, const Square &enpassant, const uint8_t &half_moves,
1811 const Piece &captured_piece)
1812 : hash(hash),
1813 castling(castling),
1814 enpassant(enpassant),
1815 half_moves(half_moves),
1816 captured_piece(captured_piece) {}
1817 };

1826 prev_states_.reserve(256);
1827 chess960_ = chess960;
1828 setFenInternal<true>(fen);
1829 }

1831 virtual void setFen(std::string_view fen) { setFenInternal(fen); }

1833 static Board fromFen(std::string_view fen) { return Board(fen); }
1834 static Board fromEpd(std::string_view epd) {
1835 Board board;
1836 board.setEpd(epd);
1837 return board;

1839
1840 void setEpd(const std::string_view epd) {
1841 auto parts = utils::splitString(epd, ' ');
1842
1843#ifndef CHESS_NO_EXCEPTIONS
1844 if (parts.size() < 1) throw std::runtime_error("Invalid EPD");
1845#else
1846 if (parts.size() < 1) return;
1847#endif
1848
1849 int hm = 0;
1850 int fm = 1;
1851
1852 static auto parseStringViewToInt = [](std::string_view sv) -> std::optional<int> {
1853 if (!sv.empty() && sv.back() == ';') sv.remove_suffix(1);
1854#ifndef CHESS_NO_EXCEPTIONS
1855 try {
1856 size_t pos;
1857 int value = std::stoi(std::string(sv), &pos);
1858 if (pos == sv.size()) return value;
1859 } catch (...) {
1860 }
1861#else
1862 size_t pos;
1863 int value = std::stoi(std::string(sv), &pos);
1864 if (pos == sv.size()) return value;
1865#endif
1866 return std::nullopt;
1867 };
1868
1869 if (auto it = std::find(parts.begin(), parts.end(), "hmvc"); it != parts.end()) {
1870 auto num = *(it + 1);
1871
1872 hm = parseStringViewToInt(num).value_or(0);
1873 }
1874
1875 if (auto it = std::find(parts.begin(), parts.end(), "fmvn"); it != parts.end()) {
1876 auto num = *(it + 1);
1877
1878 fm = parseStringViewToInt(num).value_or(1);
1879 }
1880
1881 auto fen = std::string(parts[0]) + " " + std::string(parts[1]) + " " + std::string(parts[2]) + " " +
1882 std::string(parts[3]) + " " + std::to_string(hm) + " " + std::to_string(fm);
1883
1884 setFen(fen);
1885 }
1886
1892 [[nodiscard]] std::string getFen(bool move_counters = true) const {
1893 std::string ss;
1894 ss.reserve(100);
1895
1896 // Loop through the ranks of the board in reverse order
1897 for (int rank = 7; rank >= 0; rank--) {
1898 std::uint32_t free_space = 0;
1899
1900 // Loop through the files of the board
1901 for (int file = 0; file < 8; file++) {
1902 // Calculate the square index
1903 const int sq = rank * 8 + file;
1904
1905 // If there is a piece at the current square
1906 if (Piece piece = at(Square(sq)); piece != Piece::NONE) {
1907 // If there were any empty squares before this piece,
1908 // append the number of empty squares to the FEN string
1909 if (free_space) {
1910 ss += std::to_string(free_space);
1911 free_space = 0;
1912 }
1913
1914 // Append the character representing the piece to the FEN string
1915 ss += static_cast<std::string>(piece);
1916 } else {
1917 // If there is no piece at the current square, increment the
1918 // counter for the number of empty squares
1919 free_space++;
1920 }
1921 }
1922
1923 // If there are any empty squares at the end of the rank,
1924 // append the number of empty squares to the FEN string
1925 if (free_space != 0) {
1926 ss += std::to_string(free_space);
1927 }
1928
1929 // Append a "/" character to the FEN string, unless this is the last rank
1930 ss += (rank > 0 ? "/" : "");
1931 }
1932
1933 // Append " w " or " b " to the FEN string, depending on which player's turn it is
1934 ss += ' ';
1935 ss += (stm_ == Color::WHITE ? 'w' : 'b');
1936
1937 // Append the appropriate characters to the FEN string to indicate
1938 // whether castling is allowed for each player
1939 if (cr_.isEmpty())
1940 ss += " -";
1941 else {
1942 ss += ' ';
1943 ss += getCastleString();
1944 }
1945
1946 // Append information about the en passant square (if any)
1947 // and the half-move clock and full move number to the FEN string
1948 if (ep_sq_ == Square::underlying::NO_SQ)
1949 ss += " -";
1950 else {
1951 ss += ' ';
1952 ss += static_cast<std::string>(ep_sq_);
1953 }
1954
1955 if (move_counters) {
1956 ss += ' ';
1957 ss += std::to_string(halfMoveClock());
1958 ss += ' ';
1959 ss += std::to_string(fullMoveNumber());
1960 }
1961
1962 // Return the resulting FEN string
1963 return ss;
1964 }
1965
1966 [[nodiscard]] std::string getEpd() const {
1967 std::string ss;
1968 ss.reserve(100);
1969
1970 ss += getFen(false);
1971 ss += " hmvc ";
1972 ss += std::to_string(halfMoveClock()) + ";";
1973 ss += " fmvn ";
1974 ss += std::to_string(fullMoveNumber()) + ";";
1975
1976 return ss;
1977 }
1978
1987 template <bool EXACT = false>
1988 void makeMove(const Move move) {
1989 const auto capture = at(move.to()) != Piece::NONE && move.typeOf() != Move::CASTLING;
1990 const auto captured = at(move.to());
1991 const auto pt = at<PieceType>(move.from());
1992
1993 // Validate side to move
1994 assert((at(move.from()) < Piece::BLACKPAWN) == (stm_ == Color::WHITE));
1995
1996 prev_states_.emplace_back(key_, cr_, ep_sq_, hfm_, captured);
1997
1998 hfm_++;
1999 plies_++;
2000
2001 if (ep_sq_ != Square::underlying::NO_SQ) key_ ^= Zobrist::enpassant(ep_sq_.file());
2002 ep_sq_ = Square::underlying::NO_SQ;
2003
2004 if (capture) {
2005 removePiece(captured, move.to());
2006
2007 hfm_ = 0;
2008 key_ ^= Zobrist::piece(captured, move.to());
2009
2010 // remove castling rights if rook is captured
2011 if (captured.type() == PieceType::ROOK && Rank::back_rank(move.to().rank(), ~stm_)) {
2012 const auto king_sq = kingSq(~stm_);
2013 const auto file = CastlingRights::closestSide(move.to(), king_sq);
2014
2015 if (cr_.getRookFile(~stm_, file) == move.to().file()) {
2016 key_ ^= Zobrist::castlingIndex(cr_.clear(~stm_, file));
2017 }
2018 }
2019 }
2020
2021 // remove castling rights if king moves
2022 if (pt == PieceType::KING && cr_.has(stm_)) {
2023 key_ ^= Zobrist::castling(cr_.hashIndex());
2024 cr_.clear(stm_);
2025 key_ ^= Zobrist::castling(cr_.hashIndex());
2026 } else if (pt == PieceType::ROOK && Square::back_rank(move.from(), stm_)) {
2027 const auto king_sq = kingSq(stm_);
2028 const auto file = CastlingRights::closestSide(move.from(), king_sq);
2029
2030 // remove castling rights if rook moves from back rank
2031 if (cr_.getRookFile(stm_, file) == move.from().file()) {
2032 key_ ^= Zobrist::castlingIndex(cr_.clear(stm_, file));
2033 }
2034 } else if (pt == PieceType::PAWN) {
2035 hfm_ = 0;
2036
2037 // double push
2038 if (Square::value_distance(move.to(), move.from()) == 16) {
2039 // imaginary attacks from the ep square from the pawn which moved
2040 Bitboard ep_mask = attacks::pawn(stm_, move.to().ep_square());
2041
2042 // add enpassant hash if enemy pawns are attacking the square
2043 if (static_cast<bool>(ep_mask & pieces(PieceType::PAWN, ~stm_))) {
2044 int found = -1;
2045
2046 // check if the enemy can legally capture the pawn on the next move
2047 if constexpr (EXACT) {
2048 const auto piece = at(move.from());
2049
2050 found = 0;
2051
2052 removePieceInternal(piece, move.from());
2053 placePieceInternal(piece, move.to());
2054
2055 stm_ = ~stm_;
2056
2057 bool valid;
2058
2059 if (stm_ == Color::WHITE) {
2060 valid = movegen::isEpSquareValid<Color::WHITE>(*this, move.to().ep_square());
2061 } else {
2062 valid = movegen::isEpSquareValid<Color::BLACK>(*this, move.to().ep_square());
2063 }
2064
2065 if (valid) found = 1;
2066
2067 // undo
2068 stm_ = ~stm_;
2069
2070 removePieceInternal(piece, move.to());
2071 placePieceInternal(piece, move.from());
2072 }
2073
2074 if (found != 0) {
2075 assert(at(move.to().ep_square()) == Piece::NONE);
2076 ep_sq_ = move.to().ep_square();
2077 key_ ^= Zobrist::enpassant(move.to().ep_square().file());
2078 }
2079 }
2080 }
2081 }
2082
2083 if (move.typeOf() == Move::CASTLING) {
2084 assert(at<PieceType>(move.from()) == PieceType::KING);
2085 assert(at<PieceType>(move.to()) == PieceType::ROOK);
2086
2087 const bool king_side = move.to() > move.from();
2088 const auto rookTo = Square::castling_rook_square(king_side, stm_);
2089 const auto kingTo = Square::castling_king_square(king_side, stm_);
2090
2091 const auto king = at(move.from());
2092 const auto rook = at(move.to());
2093
2094 removePiece(king, move.from());
2095 removePiece(rook, move.to());
2096
2097 assert(king == Piece(PieceType::KING, stm_));
2098 assert(rook == Piece(PieceType::ROOK, stm_));
2099
2100 placePiece(king, kingTo);
2101 placePiece(rook, rookTo);
2102
2103 key_ ^= Zobrist::piece(king, move.from()) ^ Zobrist::piece(king, kingTo);
2104 key_ ^= Zobrist::piece(rook, move.to()) ^ Zobrist::piece(rook, rookTo);
2105 } else if (move.typeOf() == Move::PROMOTION) {
2106 const auto piece_pawn = Piece(PieceType::PAWN, stm_);
2107 const auto piece_prom = Piece(move.promotionType(), stm_);
2108
2109 removePiece(piece_pawn, move.from());
2110 placePiece(piece_prom, move.to());
2111
2112 key_ ^= Zobrist::piece(piece_pawn, move.from()) ^ Zobrist::piece(piece_prom, move.to());
2113 } else {
2114 assert(at(move.from()) != Piece::NONE);
2115 assert(at(move.to()) == Piece::NONE);
2116
2117 const auto piece = at(move.from());
2118
2119 removePiece(piece, move.from());
2120 placePiece(piece, move.to());
2121
2122 key_ ^= Zobrist::piece(piece, move.from()) ^ Zobrist::piece(piece, move.to());
2123 }
2124
2125 if (move.typeOf() == Move::ENPASSANT) {
2126 assert(at<PieceType>(move.to().ep_square()) == PieceType::PAWN);
2127
2128 const auto piece = Piece(PieceType::PAWN, ~stm_);
2129
2130 removePiece(piece, move.to().ep_square());
2131
2132 key_ ^= Zobrist::piece(piece, move.to().ep_square());
2133 }
2134
2135 key_ ^= Zobrist::sideToMove();
2136 stm_ = ~stm_;
2137 }
2138
2139 void unmakeMove(const Move move) {
2140 const auto prev = prev_states_.back();
2141 prev_states_.pop_back();
2142
2143 ep_sq_ = prev.enpassant;
2144 cr_ = prev.castling;
2145 hfm_ = prev.half_moves;
2146 stm_ = ~stm_;
2147 plies_--;
2148
2149 if (move.typeOf() == Move::CASTLING) {
2150 const bool king_side = move.to() > move.from();
2151 const auto rook_from_sq = Square(king_side ? File::FILE_F : File::FILE_D, move.from().rank());
2152 const auto king_to_sq = Square(king_side ? File::FILE_G : File::FILE_C, move.from().rank());
2153
2154 assert(at<PieceType>(rook_from_sq) == PieceType::ROOK);
2155 assert(at<PieceType>(king_to_sq) == PieceType::KING);
2156
2157 const auto rook = at(rook_from_sq);
2158 const auto king = at(king_to_sq);
2159
2160 removePiece(rook, rook_from_sq);
2161 removePiece(king, king_to_sq);
2162
2163 assert(king == Piece(PieceType::KING, stm_));
2164 assert(rook == Piece(PieceType::ROOK, stm_));
2165
2166 placePiece(king, move.from());
2167 placePiece(rook, move.to());
2168
2169 key_ = prev.hash;
2170
2171 return;
2172 } else if (move.typeOf() == Move::PROMOTION) {
2173 const auto pawn = Piece(PieceType::PAWN, stm_);
2174 const auto piece = at(move.to());
2175
2176 assert(piece.type() == move.promotionType());
2177 assert(piece.type() != PieceType::PAWN);
2178 assert(piece.type() != PieceType::KING);
2179 assert(piece.type() != PieceType::NONE);
2180
2181 removePiece(piece, move.to());
2182 placePiece(pawn, move.from());
2183
2184 if (prev.captured_piece != Piece::NONE) {
2185 assert(at(move.to()) == Piece::NONE);
2186 placePiece(prev.captured_piece, move.to());
2187 }
2188
2189 key_ = prev.hash;
2190 return;
2191 } else {
2192 assert(at(move.to()) != Piece::NONE);
2193 assert(at(move.from()) == Piece::NONE);
2194
2195 const auto piece = at(move.to());
2196
2197 removePiece(piece, move.to());
2198 placePiece(piece, move.from());
2199 }
2200
2201 if (move.typeOf() == Move::ENPASSANT) {
2202 const auto pawn = Piece(PieceType::PAWN, ~stm_);
2203 const auto pawnTo = static_cast<Square>(ep_sq_ ^ 8);
2204
2205 assert(at(pawnTo) == Piece::NONE);
2206
2207 placePiece(pawn, pawnTo);
2208 } else if (prev.captured_piece != Piece::NONE) {
2209 assert(at(move.to()) == Piece::NONE);
2210
2211 placePiece(prev.captured_piece, move.to());
2212 }
2213
2214 key_ = prev.hash;
2215 }
2216
2220 void makeNullMove() {
2221 prev_states_.emplace_back(key_, cr_, ep_sq_, hfm_, Piece::NONE);
2222
2223 key_ ^= Zobrist::sideToMove();
2224 if (ep_sq_ != Square::underlying::NO_SQ) key_ ^= Zobrist::enpassant(ep_sq_.file());
2225 ep_sq_ = Square::underlying::NO_SQ;
2226
2227 stm_ = ~stm_;
2228
2229 plies_++;
2230 }
2231
2235 void unmakeNullMove() {
2236 const auto &prev = prev_states_.back();
2237
2238 ep_sq_ = prev.enpassant;
2239 cr_ = prev.castling;
2240 hfm_ = prev.half_moves;
2241 key_ = prev.hash;
2242
2243 plies_--;
2244
2245 stm_ = ~stm_;
2246
2247 prev_states_.pop_back();
2248 }

2312 assert(sq.index() < 64 && sq.index() >= 0);
2313
2314 if constexpr (std::is_same_v<T, PieceType>) {
2315 return board_[sq.index()].type();
2316 } else {
2317 return board_[sq.index()];
2318 }

2356 [[nodiscard]] std::string getCastleString() const {
2357 static const auto get_file = [](const CastlingRights &cr, Color c, CastlingRights::Side side) {
2358 auto file = static_cast<std::string>(cr.getRookFile(c, side));
2359 return c == Color::WHITE ? std::toupper(file[0]) : file[0];
2360 };
2361
2362 if (chess960_) {
2363 std::string ss;
2364
2365 for (auto color : {Color::WHITE, Color::BLACK})
2366 for (auto side : {CastlingRights::Side::KING_SIDE, CastlingRights::Side::QUEEN_SIDE})
2367 if (cr_.has(color, side)) ss += get_file(cr_, color, side);
2368
2369 return ss;
2370 }
2371
2372 std::string ss;
2373
2374 if (cr_.has(Color::WHITE, CastlingRights::Side::KING_SIDE)) ss += 'K';
2375 if (cr_.has(Color::WHITE, CastlingRights::Side::QUEEN_SIDE)) ss += 'Q';
2376 if (cr_.has(Color::BLACK, CastlingRights::Side::KING_SIDE)) ss += 'k';
2377 if (cr_.has(Color::BLACK, CastlingRights::Side::QUEEN_SIDE)) ss += 'q';
2378
2379 return ss;
2380 }
2381
2388 [[nodiscard]] bool isRepetition(int count = 2) const {
2389 uint8_t c = 0;
2390
2391 // We start the loop from the back and go forward in moves, at most to the
2392 // last move which reset the half-move counter because repetitions cant
2393 // be across half-moves.
2394 const auto size = static_cast<int>(prev_states_.size());
2395
2396 for (int i = size - 2; i >= 0 && i >= size - hfm_ - 1; i -= 2) {
2397 if (prev_states_[i].hash == key_) c++;
2398 if (c == count) return true;
2399 }
2400
2401 return false;
2402 }
2403
2412 [[nodiscard]] bool isHalfMoveDraw() const { return hfm_ >= 100; }
2413
2418 [[nodiscard]] std::pair<GameResultReason, GameResult> getHalfMoveDrawType() const {
2419 Movelist movelist;
2420 movegen::legalmoves(movelist, *this);
2421
2422 if (movelist.empty() && inCheck()) {
2423 return {GameResultReason::CHECKMATE, GameResult::LOSE};
2424 }
2425
2426 return {GameResultReason::FIFTY_MOVE_RULE, GameResult::DRAW};
2427 }
2428
2433 [[nodiscard]] bool isInsufficientMaterial() const {
2434 const auto count = occ().count();
2435
2436 // only kings, draw
2437 if (count == 2) return true;
2438
2439 // only bishop + knight, cant mate
2440 if (count == 3) {
2441 if (pieces(PieceType::BISHOP, Color::WHITE) || pieces(PieceType::BISHOP, Color::BLACK)) return true;
2442 if (pieces(PieceType::KNIGHT, Color::WHITE) || pieces(PieceType::KNIGHT, Color::BLACK)) return true;
2443 }
2444
2445 // same colored bishops, cant mate
2446 if (count == 4) {
2447 if (pieces(PieceType::BISHOP, Color::WHITE) && pieces(PieceType::BISHOP, Color::BLACK) &&
2448 Square::same_color(pieces(PieceType::BISHOP, Color::WHITE).lsb(),
2449 pieces(PieceType::BISHOP, Color::BLACK).lsb()))
2450 return true;
2451
2452 // one side with two bishops which have the same color
2453 auto white_bishops = pieces(PieceType::BISHOP, Color::WHITE);
2454 auto black_bishops = pieces(PieceType::BISHOP, Color::BLACK);
2455
2456 if (white_bishops.count() == 2) {
2457 if (Square::same_color(white_bishops.lsb(), white_bishops.msb())) return true;
2458 } else if (black_bishops.count() == 2) {
2459 if (Square::same_color(black_bishops.lsb(), black_bishops.msb())) return true;
2460 }
2461 }
2462
2463 return false;
2464 }
2465
2472 [[nodiscard]] std::pair<GameResultReason, GameResult> isGameOver() const {
2473 if (isHalfMoveDraw()) return getHalfMoveDrawType();
2474 if (isInsufficientMaterial()) return {GameResultReason::INSUFFICIENT_MATERIAL, GameResult::DRAW};
2475 if (isRepetition()) return {GameResultReason::THREEFOLD_REPETITION, GameResult::DRAW};
2476
2477 Movelist movelist;
2478 movegen::legalmoves(movelist, *this);
2479
2480 if (movelist.empty()) {
2481 if (inCheck()) return {GameResultReason::CHECKMATE, GameResult::LOSE};
2482 return {GameResultReason::STALEMATE, GameResult::DRAW};
2483 }
2484
2485 return {GameResultReason::NONE, GameResult::NONE};
2486 }
2487
2494 [[nodiscard]] bool isAttacked(Square square, Color color) const {
2495 // cheap checks first
2496 if (attacks::pawn(~color, square) & pieces(PieceType::PAWN, color)) return true;
2497 if (attacks::knight(square) & pieces(PieceType::KNIGHT, color)) return true;
2498 if (attacks::king(square) & pieces(PieceType::KING, color)) return true;
2499
2500 if (attacks::bishop(square, occ()) & (pieces(PieceType::BISHOP, color) | pieces(PieceType::QUEEN, color)))
2501 return true;
2502
2503 if (attacks::rook(square, occ()) & (pieces(PieceType::ROOK, color) | pieces(PieceType::QUEEN, color)))
2504 return true;
2505
2506 return false;
2507 }
2508
2513 [[nodiscard]] bool inCheck() const { return isAttacked(kingSq(stm_), ~stm_); }
2514
2520 [[nodiscard]] bool hasNonPawnMaterial(Color color) const {
2521 return bool(pieces(PieceType::KNIGHT, color) | pieces(PieceType::BISHOP, color) |
2522 pieces(PieceType::ROOK, color) | pieces(PieceType::QUEEN, color));
2523 }
2524
2529 [[nodiscard]] U64 zobrist() const {
2530 U64 hash_key = 0ULL;
2531
2532 auto wPieces = us(Color::WHITE);
2533 auto bPieces = us(Color::BLACK);
2534
2535 while (wPieces.getBits()) {
2536 const Square sq = wPieces.pop();
2537 hash_key ^= Zobrist::piece(at(sq), sq);
2538 }
2539
2540 while (bPieces.getBits()) {
2541 const Square sq = bPieces.pop();
2542 hash_key ^= Zobrist::piece(at(sq), sq);
2543 }
2544
2545 U64 ep_hash = 0ULL;
2546 if (ep_sq_ != Square::underlying::NO_SQ) ep_hash ^= Zobrist::enpassant(ep_sq_.file());
2547
2548 U64 stm_hash = 0ULL;
2549 if (stm_ == Color::WHITE) stm_hash ^= Zobrist::sideToMove();
2550
2551 U64 castling_hash = 0ULL;
2552 castling_hash ^= Zobrist::castling(cr_.hashIndex());
2553
2554 return hash_key ^ ep_hash ^ stm_hash ^ castling_hash;
2555 }

2558
2562 class Compact {
2563 friend class Board;
2564 Compact() = default;
2565
2566 public:
2572 static PackedBoard encode(const Board &board) { return encodeState(board); }
2573
2574 static PackedBoard encode(std::string_view fen, bool chess960 = false) { return encodeState(fen, chess960); }
2575
2582 static Board decode(const PackedBoard &compressed, bool chess960 = false) {
2583 Board board = Board(PrivateCtor::CREATE);
2584 board.chess960_ = chess960;
2585 decode(board, compressed);
2586 return board;
2587 }
2588
2589 private:
2610 static PackedBoard encodeState(const Board &board) {
2611 PackedBoard packed{};
2612
2613 packed[0] = board.occ().getBits() >> 56;
2614 packed[1] = (board.occ().getBits() >> 48) & 0xFF;
2615 packed[2] = (board.occ().getBits() >> 40) & 0xFF;
2616 packed[3] = (board.occ().getBits() >> 32) & 0xFF;
2617 packed[4] = (board.occ().getBits() >> 24) & 0xFF;
2618 packed[5] = (board.occ().getBits() >> 16) & 0xFF;
2619 packed[6] = (board.occ().getBits() >> 8) & 0xFF;
2620 packed[7] = board.occ().getBits() & 0xFF;
2621
2622 auto offset = 8 * 2;
2623 auto occ = board.occ();
2624
2625 while (occ) {
2626 // we now fill the packed array, since our convertedpiece only actually needs 4 bits,
2627 // we can store 2 pieces in one byte.
2628 const auto sq = Square(occ.pop());
2629 const auto shift = (offset % 2 == 0 ? 4 : 0);
2630 const auto meaning = convertMeaning(board.cr_, board.sideToMove(), board.ep_sq_, sq, board.at(sq));
2631 const auto nibble = meaning << shift;
2632
2633 packed[offset / 2] |= nibble;
2634 offset++;
2635 }
2636
2637 return packed;
2638 }
2639
2640 static PackedBoard encodeState(std::string_view fen, bool chess960 = false) {
2641 // fallback to slower method
2642 if (chess960) {
2643 Board board = Board(fen, true);
2644 return encodeState(board);
2645 }
2646
2647 PackedBoard packed{};
2648
2649 while (fen[0] == ' ') fen.remove_prefix(1);
2650
2651 const auto params = split_string_view<6>(fen);
2652 const auto position = params[0].has_value() ? *params[0] : "";
2653 const auto move_right = params[1].has_value() ? *params[1] : "w";
2654 const auto castling = params[2].has_value() ? *params[2] : "-";
2655 const auto en_passant = params[3].has_value() ? *params[3] : "-";
2656
2657 const auto ep = en_passant == "-" ? Square::underlying::NO_SQ : Square(en_passant);
2658 const auto stm = (move_right == "w") ? Color::WHITE : Color::BLACK;
2659
2660 CastlingRights cr;
2661
2662 for (char i : castling) {
2663 if (i == '-') break;
2664
2665 const auto king_side = CastlingRights::Side::KING_SIDE;
2666 const auto queen_side = CastlingRights::Side::QUEEN_SIDE;
2667
2668 if (i == 'K') cr.setCastlingRight(Color::WHITE, king_side, File::FILE_H);
2669 if (i == 'Q') cr.setCastlingRight(Color::WHITE, queen_side, File::FILE_A);
2670 if (i == 'k') cr.setCastlingRight(Color::BLACK, king_side, File::FILE_H);
2671 if (i == 'q') cr.setCastlingRight(Color::BLACK, queen_side, File::FILE_A);
2672
2673 assert(i == 'K' || i == 'Q' || i == 'k' || i == 'q');
2674
2675 continue;
2676 }
2677
2678 const auto parts = split_string_view<8>(position, '/');
2679
2680 auto offset = 8 * 2;
2681 auto square = 0;
2682 auto occ = Bitboard(0);
2683
2684 for (auto i = parts.rbegin(); i != parts.rend(); i++) {
2685 auto part = *i;
2686
2687 for (char curr : *part) {
2688 if (isdigit(curr)) {
2689 square += (curr - '0');
2690 } else if (curr == '/') {
2691 square++;
2692 } else {
2693 const auto p = Piece(std::string_view(&curr, 1));
2694 const auto shift = (offset % 2 == 0 ? 4 : 0);
2695
2696 packed[offset / 2] |= convertMeaning(cr, stm, ep, Square(square), p) << shift;
2697 offset++;
2698
2699 occ.set(square);
2700 ++square;
2701 }
2702 }
2703 }
2704
2705 packed[0] = occ.getBits() >> 56;
2706 packed[1] = (occ.getBits() >> 48) & 0xFF;
2707 packed[2] = (occ.getBits() >> 40) & 0xFF;
2708 packed[3] = (occ.getBits() >> 32) & 0xFF;
2709 packed[4] = (occ.getBits() >> 24) & 0xFF;
2710 packed[5] = (occ.getBits() >> 16) & 0xFF;
2711 packed[6] = (occ.getBits() >> 8) & 0xFF;
2712 packed[7] = occ.getBits() & 0xFF;
2713
2714 return packed;
2715 }
2716
2717 static void decode(Board &board, const PackedBoard &compressed) {
2718 Bitboard occupied = 0ull;
2719
2720 for (int i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
2721 occupied |= Bitboard(compressed[i]) << (56 - i * 8);
2722 }
2723
2724 int offset = 16;
2725 int white_castle_idx = 0, black_castle_idx = 0;
2726 File white_castle[2] = {File::NO_FILE, File::NO_FILE};
2727 File black_castle[2] = {File::NO_FILE, File::NO_FILE};
2728
2729 // clear board state
2730
2731 board.hfm_ = 0;
2732 board.plies_ = 0;
2733
2734 board.stm_ = Color::WHITE;
2735
2736 board.cr_.clear();
2737 board.prev_states_.clear();
2738 board.original_fen_.clear();
2739
2740 board.occ_bb_.fill(0ULL);
2741 board.pieces_bb_.fill(0ULL);
2742 board.board_.fill(Piece::NONE);
2743
2744 // place pieces back on the board
2745 while (occupied) {
2746 const auto sq = Square(occupied.pop());
2747 const auto nibble = compressed[offset / 2] >> (offset % 2 == 0 ? 4 : 0) & 0b1111;
2748 const auto piece = convertPiece(nibble);
2749
2750 if (piece != Piece::NONE) {
2751 board.placePiece(piece, sq);
2752
2753 offset++;
2754 continue;
2755 }
2756
2757 // Piece has a special meaning, interpret it from the raw integer
2758 // pawn with ep square behind it
2759 if (nibble == 12) {
2760 board.ep_sq_ = sq.ep_square();
2761 // depending on the rank this is a white or black pawn
2762 auto color = sq.rank() == Rank::RANK_4 ? Color::WHITE : Color::BLACK;
2763 board.placePiece(Piece(PieceType::PAWN, color), sq);
2764 }
2765 // castling rights for white
2766 else if (nibble == 13) {
2767 assert(white_castle_idx < 2);
2768 white_castle[white_castle_idx++] = sq.file();
2769 board.placePiece(Piece(PieceType::ROOK, Color::WHITE), sq);
2770 }
2771 // castling rights for black
2772 else if (nibble == 14) {
2773 assert(black_castle_idx < 2);
2774 black_castle[black_castle_idx++] = sq.file();
2775 board.placePiece(Piece(PieceType::ROOK, Color::BLACK), sq);
2776 }
2777 // black to move
2778 else if (nibble == 15) {
2779 board.stm_ = Color::BLACK;
2780 board.placePiece(Piece(PieceType::KING, Color::BLACK), sq);
2781 }
2782
2783 offset++;
2784 }
2785
2786 // reapply castling
2787 for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
2788 if (white_castle[i] != File::NO_FILE) {
2789 const auto king_sq = board.kingSq(Color::WHITE);
2790 const auto file = white_castle[i];
2791 const auto side = CastlingRights::closestSide(file, king_sq.file());
2792
2793 board.cr_.setCastlingRight(Color::WHITE, side, file);
2794 }
2795
2796 if (black_castle[i] != File::NO_FILE) {
2797 const auto king_sq = board.kingSq(Color::BLACK);
2798 const auto file = black_castle[i];
2799 const auto side = CastlingRights::closestSide(file, king_sq.file());
2800
2801 board.cr_.setCastlingRight(Color::BLACK, side, file);
2802 }
2803 }
2804
2805 if (board.stm_ == Color::BLACK) {
2806 board.plies_++;
2807 }
2808
2809 board.key_ = board.zobrist();
2810 }
2811
2812 // 1:1 mapping of Piece::internal() to the compressed piece
2813 static std::uint8_t convertPiece(Piece piece) { return int(piece.internal()); }
2814
2815 // for pieces with a special meaning return Piece::NONE since this is otherwise not used
2816 static Piece convertPiece(std::uint8_t piece) {
2817 if (piece >= 12) return Piece::NONE;
2818 return Piece(Piece::underlying(piece));
2819 }
2820
2821 // 12 => theres an ep square behind the pawn, rank will be deduced from the rank
2822 // 13 => any white rook with castling rights, side will be deduced from the file
2823 // 14 => any black rook with castling rights, side will be deduced from the file
2824 // 15 => black king and black is side to move
2825 static std::uint8_t convertMeaning(const CastlingRights &cr, Color stm, Square ep, Square sq, Piece piece) {
2826 if (piece.type() == PieceType::PAWN && ep != Square::underlying::NO_SQ) {
2827 if (Square(static_cast<int>(sq.index()) ^ 8) == ep) return 12;
2828 }
2829
2830 if (piece.type() == PieceType::ROOK) {
2831 if (piece.color() == Color::WHITE && Square::back_rank(sq, Color::WHITE) &&
2832 (cr.getRookFile(Color::WHITE, CastlingRights::Side::KING_SIDE) == sq.file() ||
2833 cr.getRookFile(Color::WHITE, CastlingRights::Side::QUEEN_SIDE) == sq.file()))
2834 return 13;
2835 if (piece.color() == Color::BLACK && Square::back_rank(sq, Color::BLACK) &&
2836 (cr.getRookFile(Color::BLACK, CastlingRights::Side::KING_SIDE) == sq.file() ||
2837 cr.getRookFile(Color::BLACK, CastlingRights::Side::QUEEN_SIDE) == sq.file()))
2838 return 14;
2839 }
2840
2841 if (piece.type() == PieceType::KING && piece.color() == Color::BLACK && stm == Color::BLACK) {
2842 return 15;
2843 }
2844
2845 return convertPiece(piece);
2846 }
2847 };
2848
2849 protected:
2850 virtual void placePiece(Piece piece, Square sq) { placePieceInternal(piece, sq); }
2851
2852 virtual void removePiece(Piece piece, Square sq) { removePieceInternal(piece, sq); }
2853
2854 std::vector<State> prev_states_;
2855
2856 std::array<Bitboard, 6> pieces_bb_ = {};
2857 std::array<Bitboard, 2> occ_bb_ = {};
2858 std::array<Piece, 64> board_ = {};
2859
2860 U64 key_ = 0ULL;
2861 CastlingRights cr_ = {};
2862 uint16_t plies_ = 0;
2863 Color stm_ = Color::WHITE;
2864 Square ep_sq_ = Square::underlying::NO_SQ;
2865 uint8_t hfm_ = 0;
2866
2867 bool chess960_ = false;
2868
2869 private:
2870 void removePieceInternal(Piece piece, Square sq) {
2871 assert(board_[sq.index()] == piece && piece != Piece::NONE);
2872
2873 auto type = piece.type();
2874 auto color = piece.color();
2875 auto index = sq.index();
2876
2877 assert(type != PieceType::NONE);
2878 assert(color != Color::NONE);
2879 assert(index >= 0 && index < 64);
2880
2881 pieces_bb_[type].clear(index);
2882 occ_bb_[color].clear(index);
2883 board_[index] = Piece::NONE;
2884 }
2885
2886 void placePieceInternal(Piece piece, Square sq) {
2887 assert(board_[sq.index()] == Piece::NONE);
2888
2889 auto type = piece.type();
2890 auto color = piece.color();
2891 auto index = sq.index();
2892
2893 assert(type != PieceType::NONE);
2894 assert(color != Color::NONE);
2895 assert(index >= 0 && index < 64);
2896
2897 pieces_bb_[type].set(index);
2898 occ_bb_[color].set(index);
2899 board_[index] = piece;
2900 }
2901
2902 template <bool ctor = false>
2903 void setFenInternal(std::string_view fen) {
2904 original_fen_ = fen;
2905
2906 occ_bb_.fill(0ULL);
2907 pieces_bb_.fill(0ULL);
2908 board_.fill(Piece::NONE);
2909
2910 // find leading whitespaces and remove them
2911 while (fen[0] == ' ') fen.remove_prefix(1);
2912
2913 const auto params = split_string_view<6>(fen);
2914 const auto position = params[0].has_value() ? *params[0] : "";
2915 const auto move_right = params[1].has_value() ? *params[1] : "w";
2916 const auto castling = params[2].has_value() ? *params[2] : "-";
2917 const auto en_passant = params[3].has_value() ? *params[3] : "-";
2918 const auto half_move = params[4].has_value() ? *params[4] : "0";
2919 const auto full_move = params[5].has_value() ? *params[5] : "1";
2920
2921 static auto parseStringViewToInt = [](std::string_view sv) -> std::optional<int> {
2922 if (!sv.empty() && sv.back() == ';') sv.remove_suffix(1);
2923#ifndef CHESS_NO_EXCEPTIONS
2924 try {
2925 size_t pos;
2926 int value = std::stoi(std::string(sv), &pos);
2927 if (pos == sv.size()) return value;
2928 } catch (...) {
2929 }
2930#else
2931 size_t pos;
2932 int value = std::stoi(std::string(sv), &pos);
2933 if (pos == sv.size()) return value;
2934#endif
2935 return std::nullopt;
2936 };
2937
2938 // Half move clock
2939 hfm_ = parseStringViewToInt(half_move).value_or(0);
2940
2941 // Full move number
2942 plies_ = parseStringViewToInt(full_move).value_or(1);
2943
2944 plies_ = plies_ * 2 - 2;
2945 ep_sq_ = en_passant == "-" ? Square::underlying::NO_SQ : Square(en_passant);
2946 stm_ = (move_right == "w") ? Color::WHITE : Color::BLACK;
2947 key_ = 0ULL;
2948 cr_.clear();
2949 prev_states_.clear();
2950
2951 if (stm_ == Color::BLACK) {
2952 plies_++;
2953 } else {
2954 key_ ^= Zobrist::sideToMove();
2955 }
2956
2957 auto square = 56;
2958 for (char curr : position) {
2959 if (isdigit(curr)) {
2960 square += (curr - '0');
2961 } else if (curr == '/') {
2962 square -= 16;
2963 } else {
2964 auto p = Piece(std::string_view(&curr, 1));
2965
2966 // prevent warnings about virtual method bypassing virtual dispatch
2967 if constexpr (ctor) {
2968 placePieceInternal(p, Square(square));
2969 } else {
2970 placePiece(p, square);
2971 }
2972
2973 key_ ^= Zobrist::piece(p, Square(square));
2974 ++square;
2975 }
2976 }
2977
2978 static const auto find_rook = [](const Board &board, CastlingRights::Side side, Color color) {
2979 const auto king_side = CastlingRights::Side::KING_SIDE;
2980 const auto king_sq = board.kingSq(color);
2981 const auto sq_corner = Square(side == king_side ? Square::underlying::SQ_H1 : Square::underlying::SQ_A1)
2982 .relative_square(color);
2983
2984 const auto start = side == king_side ? king_sq + 1 : king_sq - 1;
2985
2986 for (Square sq = start; (side == king_side ? sq <= sq_corner : sq >= sq_corner);
2987 (side == king_side ? sq++ : sq--)) {
2988 if (board.at<PieceType>(sq) == PieceType::ROOK && board.at(sq).color() == color) {
2989 return sq.file();
2990 }
2991 }
2992
2993#ifndef CHESS_NO_EXCEPTIONS
2994 throw std::runtime_error("Invalid position");
2995#endif
2996
2997 return File(File::NO_FILE);
2998 };
2999
3000 for (char i : castling) {
3001 if (i == '-') break;
3002
3003 const auto king_side = CastlingRights::Side::KING_SIDE;
3004 const auto queen_side = CastlingRights::Side::QUEEN_SIDE;
3005
3006 if (!chess960_) {
3007 if (i == 'K') cr_.setCastlingRight(Color::WHITE, king_side, File::FILE_H);
3008 if (i == 'Q') cr_.setCastlingRight(Color::WHITE, queen_side, File::FILE_A);
3009 if (i == 'k') cr_.setCastlingRight(Color::BLACK, king_side, File::FILE_H);
3010 if (i == 'q') cr_.setCastlingRight(Color::BLACK, queen_side, File::FILE_A);
3011
3012 continue;
3013 }
3014
3015 // chess960 castling detection
3016
3017 const auto color = isupper(i) ? Color::WHITE : Color::BLACK;
3018 const auto king_sq = kingSq(color);
3019
3020 // find rook on the right side of the king
3021 if (i == 'K' || i == 'k') {
3022 cr_.setCastlingRight(color, king_side, find_rook(*this, king_side, color));
3023 }
3024 // find rook on the left side of the king
3025 else if (i == 'Q' || i == 'q') {
3026 cr_.setCastlingRight(color, queen_side, find_rook(*this, queen_side, color));
3027 }
3028 // correct frc castling encoding
3029 else {
3030 const auto file = File(std::string_view(&i, 1));
3031 const auto side = CastlingRights::closestSide(file, king_sq.file());
3032 cr_.setCastlingRight(color, side, file);
3033 }
3034 }
3035
3036 // check if ep square itself is valid
3037 if (ep_sq_ != Square::underlying::NO_SQ && !((ep_sq_.rank() == Rank::RANK_3 && stm_ == Color::BLACK) ||
3038 (ep_sq_.rank() == Rank::RANK_6 && stm_ == Color::WHITE))) {
3039 ep_sq_ = Square::underlying::NO_SQ;
3040 }
3041
3042 // check if ep square is valid, i.e. if there is a pawn that can capture it
3043 if (ep_sq_ != Square::underlying::NO_SQ) {
3044 bool valid;
3045
3046 if (stm_ == Color::WHITE) {
3047 valid = movegen::isEpSquareValid<Color::WHITE>(*this, ep_sq_);
3048 } else {
3049 valid = movegen::isEpSquareValid<Color::BLACK>(*this, ep_sq_);
3050 }
3051
3052 if (!valid)
3053 ep_sq_ = Square::underlying::NO_SQ;
3054 else
3055 key_ ^= Zobrist::enpassant(ep_sq_.file());
3056 }
3057
3058 key_ ^= Zobrist::castling(cr_.hashIndex());
3059
3060 assert(key_ == zobrist());
3061 }
3062
3063 template <int N>
3064 std::array<std::optional<std::string_view>, N> static split_string_view(std::string_view fen,
3065 char delimiter = ' ') {
3066 std::array<std::optional<std::string_view>, N> arr = {};
3067
3068 std::size_t start = 0;
3069 std::size_t end = 0;
3070
3071 for (std::size_t i = 0; i < N; i++) {
3072 end = fen.find(delimiter, start);
3073 if (end == std::string::npos) {
3074 arr[i] = fen.substr(start);
3075 break;
3076 }
3077 arr[i] = fen.substr(start, end - start);
3078 start = end + 1;
3079 }
3080
3081 return arr;
3082 }
3083
3084 // store the original fen string
3085 // useful when setting up a frc position and the user called set960(true) afterwards
3086 std::string original_fen_;
3087};
3088
3089inline std::ostream &operator<<(std::ostream &os, const Board &b) {
3090 for (int i = 63; i >= 0; i -= 8) {
3091 for (int j = 7; j >= 0; j--) {
3092 os << " " << static_cast<std::string>(b.board_[i - j]);
3093 }
3094
3095 os << " \n";
3096 }
3097
3098 os << "\n\n";
3099 os << "Side to move: " << static_cast<int>(b.stm_.internal()) << "\n";
3100 os << "Castling rights: " << b.getCastleString() << "\n";
3101 os << "Halfmoves: " << b.halfMoveClock() << "\n";
3102 os << "Fullmoves: " << b.fullMoveNumber() << "\n";
3103 os << "EP: " << b.ep_sq_.index() << "\n";
3104 os << "Hash: " << b.key_ << "\n";
3105
3106 os << std::endl;
3107
3108 return os;
3109}

3114template <Direction direction>
3115[[nodiscard]] inline constexpr Bitboard attacks::shift(const Bitboard b) {
3116 switch (direction) {
3117 case Direction::NORTH:
3118 return b << 8;
3119 case Direction::SOUTH:
3120 return b >> 8;
3121 case Direction::NORTH_WEST:
3122 return (b & ~MASK_FILE[0]) << 7;
3123 case Direction::WEST:
3124 return (b & ~MASK_FILE[0]) >> 1;
3125 case Direction::SOUTH_WEST:
3126 return (b & ~MASK_FILE[0]) >> 9;
3127 case Direction::NORTH_EAST:
3128 return (b & ~MASK_FILE[7]) << 9;
3129 case Direction::EAST:
3130 return (b & ~MASK_FILE[7]) << 1;
3131 case Direction::SOUTH_EAST:
3132 return (b & ~MASK_FILE[7]) >> 7;
3133 }
3134
3135 // c++23
3136#if defined(__cpp_lib_unreachable) && __cpp_lib_unreachable >= 202202L
3137 std::unreachable();
3138#endif
3139
3140 assert(false);
3141
3142 return {};
3143}

3145template <Color::underlying c>
3146[[nodiscard]] inline Bitboard attacks::pawnLeftAttacks(const Bitboard pawns) {
3147 return c == Color::WHITE ? (pawns << 7) & ~MASK_FILE[static_cast<int>(File::FILE_H)]
3148 : (pawns >> 7) & ~MASK_FILE[static_cast<int>(File::FILE_A)];
3149}
3150
3151template <Color::underlying c>
3152[[nodiscard]] inline Bitboard attacks::pawnRightAttacks(const Bitboard pawns) {
3153 return c == Color::WHITE ? (pawns << 9) & ~MASK_FILE[static_cast<int>(File::FILE_A)]
3154 : (pawns >> 9) & ~MASK_FILE[static_cast<int>(File::FILE_H)];
3155}

3157[[nodiscard]] inline Bitboard attacks::pawn(Color c, Square sq) noexcept { return PawnAttacks[c][sq.index()]; }
3158
3159[[nodiscard]] inline Bitboard attacks::knight(Square sq) noexcept { return KnightAttacks[sq.index()]; }
3160

3162 return BishopTable[sq.index()].attacks[BishopTable[sq.index()](occupied)];
3163}
3164

3167}
3168
3169[[nodiscard]] inline Bitboard attacks::queen(Square sq, Bitboard occupied) noexcept {
3170 return bishop(sq, occupied) | rook(sq, occupied);
3171}
3172
3173[[nodiscard]] inline Bitboard attacks::king(Square sq) noexcept { return KingAttacks[sq.index()]; }
3174
3175[[nodiscard]] inline Bitboard attacks::attackers(const Board &board, Color color, Square square) noexcept {
3176 const auto queens = board.pieces(PieceType::QUEEN, color);
3177 const auto occupied = board.occ();
3178
3179 // using the fact that if we can attack PieceType from square, they can attack us back
3180 auto atks = (pawn(~color, square) & board.pieces(PieceType::PAWN, color));
3181 atks |= (knight(square) & board.pieces(PieceType::KNIGHT, color));
3182 atks |= (bishop(square, occupied) & (board.pieces(PieceType::BISHOP, color) | queens));
3183 atks |= (rook(square, occupied) & (board.pieces(PieceType::ROOK, color) | queens));
3184 atks |= (king(square) & board.pieces(PieceType::KING, color));
3185
3186 return atks & occupied;
3187}

3189[[nodiscard]] inline Bitboard attacks::bishopAttacks(Square sq, Bitboard occupied) {
3190 Bitboard attacks = 0ULL;
3191
3192 int r, f;
3193
3194 int br = sq.rank();
3195 int bf = sq.file();
3196
3197 for (r = br + 1, f = bf + 1; Square::is_valid(static_cast<Rank>(r), static_cast<File>(f)); r++, f++) {
3198 auto s = Square(static_cast<Rank>(r), static_cast<File>(f)).index();
3199 attacks.set(s);
3200 if (occupied.check(s)) break;
3201 }
3202
3203 for (r = br - 1, f = bf + 1; Square::is_valid(static_cast<Rank>(r), static_cast<File>(f)); r--, f++) {
3204 auto s = Square(static_cast<Rank>(r), static_cast<File>(f)).index();
3205 attacks.set(s);
3206 if (occupied.check(s)) break;
3207 }
3208
3209 for (r = br + 1, f = bf - 1; Square::is_valid(static_cast<Rank>(r), static_cast<File>(f)); r++, f--) {
3210 auto s = Square(static_cast<Rank>(r), static_cast<File>(f)).index();
3211 attacks.set(s);
3212 if (occupied.check(s)) break;
3213 }
3214
3215 for (r = br - 1, f = bf - 1; Square::is_valid(static_cast<Rank>(r), static_cast<File>(f)); r--, f--) {
3216 auto s = Square(static_cast<Rank>(r), static_cast<File>(f)).index();
3217 attacks.set(s);
3218 if (occupied.check(s)) break;
3219 }
3220
3221 return attacks;
3222}

3258
3259inline void attacks::initSliders(Square sq, Magic table[], U64 magic,
3260 const std::function<Bitboard(Square, Bitboard)> &attacks) {
3261 // The edges of the board are not considered for the attacks
3262 // i.e. for the sq h7 edges will be a1-h1, a1-a8, a8-h8, ignoring the edge of the current square
3263 const Bitboard edges = ((Bitboard(Rank::RANK_1) | Bitboard(Rank::RANK_8)) & ~Bitboard(sq.rank())) |
3264 ((Bitboard(File::FILE_A) | Bitboard(File::FILE_H)) & ~Bitboard(sq.file()));
3265
3266 U64 occ = 0ULL;
3267
3268 auto &table_sq = table[sq.index()];
3269
3270 table_sq.magic = magic;
3271 table_sq.mask = (attacks(sq, occ) & ~edges).getBits();
3272 table_sq.shift = 64 - Bitboard(table_sq.mask).count();
3273
3274 if (sq < 64 - 1) {
3275 table[sq.index() + 1].attacks = table_sq.attacks + (1ull << Bitboard(table_sq.mask).count());
3276 }
3277
3278 do {
3279 table_sq.attacks[table_sq(occ)] = attacks(sq, occ);
3280 occ = (occ - table_sq.mask) & table_sq.mask;
3281 } while (occ);
3282}
3283
3284inline void attacks::initAttacks() {
3285 BishopTable[0].attacks = BishopAttacks;
3286 RookTable[0].attacks = RookAttacks;
3287
3288 for (int i = 0; i < 64; i++) {
3289 initSliders(static_cast<Square>(i), BishopTable, BishopMagics[i], bishopAttacks);
3290 initSliders(static_cast<Square>(i), RookTable, RookMagics[i], rookAttacks);
3291 }
3292}
